author: sunce86.
content:
<@!543900561460822016>  Hey, do you know why geth changed the way gas_limit is calculated after 1559? 
https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/22896/files#diff-cbeb8282854297a2c8ef02293455cb0258ae75b1d2a1a398b2eb60e59a591ba5R143

author: lightclient
content: <@!211091239112671234> updated this - I believe the reason is that the current `CalcGasLimit` function takes into account how full the block. If the blocks isn't sufficiently full, the gas limit won't be increased (for the miner). The 1559 version doesn't account for gas used in the block and just does it's best to move the gas limit to miner-configured value while keeping the delta within the allowed amount

author: holiman
content: A pretty old version of the quilt miner PR

author: holiman
content:
It's not the gasLimit per se, it's what the miner should use for the next block. So basically how does the miner determine to push it up or down. 

Previously we upped if blocks were 75% full. Now we just target the operator's desired target
